label: 訓蒙図彙
対訳語: Illustrations and definitions to train the untutored, 1666
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 4:  Early Modern Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1991
説明文: Arranged in the topical categories of Chinese and Japanese encyclopedias, [this illustrated lexicon] provided for each of its twelve hundred words the readings, a synomym or line of definition and, in most intances, a drawing.  During the last two decades of the seventeenth century, kimmō zui were published also to teach the vocabulary and rudiments of special subjects:  military equipment, noh drama, the occupations, and flower arranging (pp. 720-721).
